modules.description: This module implements RSA-PSS signature verification using SHA256 as the hash function and provides a direct function for computing SHA256 digests of strings. It operates on string-based keys, data, and signatures, returning result types that indicate success or verification failure. Use this module to validate cryptographic signatures in secure communication protocols or verify data integrity using SHA256 hashing.

This module implements cryptographic verification operations using Mirage Crypto, focusing on signature validation and digest computation. It operates on wire-encoded data structures, cryptographic keys, and signatures, producing verified identifier mappings or error lists. It is used to validate signed identifiers in a resource-constrained context, such as verifying cryptographic identities in a distributed system.

This module handles cryptographic operations including private key decoding, RSA key generation, public key extraction, and PSS signature signing. It works with private key values of type `t`, timestamps, and string-encoded cryptographic data. Concrete use cases include loading and validating private keys, generating RSA key pairs, and signing data using PSS.

This module provides RSA-PSS signing and verification, SHA256 digest computation, and key management operations. It supports loading and validating private keys, generating RSA key pairs, signing data, and verifying signatures over wire-encoded structures or strings. The core data types include keys, timestamps, and string-encoded cryptographic values, with operations returning result types indicating success or failure. Example uses include validating signed identifiers in distributed systems, verifying data integrity in secure protocols, and signing messages with RSA-PSS.
